TopicSection.Content:
You can customize the appearance of a cell or a column by using Column Presenters. Column presenter definition uses doT.js syntax.

For example, you can use DataBar, checkbox or radio buttons instead of numbers.

The following image shows how Column presenters appears after applying code:

Sample Code

For DataBar

Type your example code here. It will be automatically colorized when you switch to Preview or build the help system. JavaScript JS CodeSamples\views_sample1\views_sample1\103_col_presenter.html Presenter

For CheckBox

Type your example code here. It will be automatically colorized when you switch to Preview or build the help system. JavaScript JS CodeSamples\views_sample1\views_sample1\103_col_presenter.html checkbox

You can use the presenter as a template string which can be rendered by grid. The presenter used in column definition replaces the default presenter.

JavaScript JS

var presenter="<span class='percent-complete-bar' style='background-color:{{?it.percentComplete<30}}
red{{??it.percentComplete<60}}silver{{??}}green{{?}};width:{{=it.percentComplete}}%;'></span>"
var columns = [
     ....
     {id: "%", name: "% Complete", field: "percentComplete", width: 80, presenter: presenter},
     ...
 ];
